file_content.text: Beginning encrypted message. This is Keeper. We have one minute until Republic intercept.
Report, Cipher Nine. Did you make contact with the SIS?
I'm inside, but there's been a complication. I don't think I can explain.
We may have a problem.
You'll have to work around it.
Cipher Nine to Keeper. I'm inside.
I'm in.
The situation is under control.
They're brainwashing me.
Understood.
Do not break cover until you are certain of Ardun Kothe's intentions. You're our only chance of learning his plans.
I believe in you, Cipher. Keeper out.
Keeper out.
She doesn't know he has control. You'll never be able to tell her.
Watch. Wait for your opportunity. It will come.
It's time to go. Don't keep the SIS waiting.
Cipher Nine--come in. Lord Jadus told us you were returning to duty.
I was fighting a war. Now I'm told I'm needed here.
I've been busy.
Yes, I requested your assistance.
Cipher Nine--come in. I was just finishing the personnel security updates.
Outside operations are complete. Reporting for duty.
I'm here for my assignment.
Then you'll be reporting to me.
I missed your calls. How long has it been?
It's good to see you.
Not so long, I think. It just feels that way.
Something looks different. Don't tell me you made it more stark?
Looks like you redecorated....
Something of the sort.
I was expecting Keeper. Is there a reason you're in this office?
What are you doing here?
Since Eradication Day, Lord Jadus has been solidifying his control. In honor of our... successes, he's made changes to our department.
Among the victims of Eradication Day were several high-ranking officials. The Dark Council took advantage of that to reward our success.
After Darth Jadus's defeat and escape, there was a great deal of chaos. The Dark Council decided to make changes.
My predecessor was elevated to Minister of Intelligence. That makes me the new Keeper of Operations Division.
You have my full support, sir.
Understood.
And I have you to thank for this.
Then we both serve the new regime. You as Jadus's servant, and I as his Hand.
And I'm Jadus's favorite.
As you say.
That's quite a promotion... shall we celebrate?
Congratulations are in order.
Lord Jadus can be... generous. But he has an aggressive timetable.
I owe this to you. But with the promotion come certain responsibilities.
I'm surprised. You fought against Jadus aboard his ship.
You're loyal to Jadus, now?
I serve the Empire. At the time, Lord Jadus... appeared to be the enemy. His mercy was most generous.
I never thought I'd miss the old Keeper.
I preferred the last boss.
The Minister is looking for a secretary, if you'd prefer his company. If you want a wartime assignment, you'll work for me.
I'm mounting an operation against the Republic Strategic Information Service. Our concern is this man--Ardun Kothe.
SIS for nearly a decade, responsible for sixteen covert projects in the Mid Rim. The best spymaster our enemies have.
I assume we've tried to assassinate him already.
Is he our target?
Yes, but no one's come close.
I've run into the Republic a lot lately... but no espionage presence.
Tell me about the SIS.
The SIS is our smaller, more flexible counterpart, supported by military and Jedi reserves.
The first thing you do as operations director is go after your Republic counterpart? Interesting.
Feeling intimidated?
This plan has been in motion for some time.
Ardun Kothe's division recently received a classified sanction from the Republic Senate. Complete autonomy; no restrictions on their activities.
The Republic believes Ardun Kothe can win the war. We need to know what he has planned.
For the Republic to give so much power to one man... surprises me.
Sounds serious.
In public, they keep to their principles. In private, they're getting desperate.
Do we have a full workup on him?
I need more background.
There's very little. Born on Dantooine, disappeared awhile then joined the SIS after the Treaty of Coruscant. Motivations unknown; revenge seems probable.
Since receiving his own division, he's instigated three slave rebellions, one corporate takeover and--we believe--inspired two of our own generals to defect.
Now imagine him with unlimited resources and no ethical restraints.
He's a danger to the Empire. What's our plan?
I see your point.
Does he have vices? A mistress? Anything?
Any weaknesses?
Not that we can find. Maybe you can do more.
Listen to that profile. Does he sound ruthless to you?
He won't have the stomach.
He sounds like someone who could change things.
I'll take a squadron of fighters to Coruscant and pick him up. See what the Senate thinks then.
Give me lots of weapons.
Clever, but the Minister approved a different approach.
Imperial Intelligence has leaked documents to the SIS suggesting that one of our trustworthy agents is... traumatized.
At the same time, we sent anonymous messages to Ardun Kothe's team from an "inside source." They now believe a Cipher is ready to turn.
I want you to make contact with the SIS and offer to be their spy inside the Empire.
I've been a pirate and a terrorist. I can be a traitor, too.
Become a double agent...
The Republic will ask me to prove myself. What then?
How far can I go?
Do what you have to, but do it discreetly. No official sanction.
The Republic will never believe I've turned, leaked reports or not.
That's foolishness.
They'll believe it if you convince them. It's what you're best at.
Your objective is to earn their confidence, uncover their plan and eliminate Ardun Kothe himself. This is a long-term, deep cover mission.
I should warn you: This sort of work can be... psychologically taxing. You will be isolated--even most Intelligence personnel won't know the truth.
I can handle the pressure. Just remember whose side I'm really on.
I'll be fine.
Kaliyo and Vector--are you asking me to abandon my squad?
What about my team? My life?
Your people don't have Intelligence backgrounds, so the SIS won't suspect them... and you'll need their support.
And what happens to us? With the promotion, the assignment, all of it...
What about our relationship?
I'm sure the Hand of Jadus has other things to care about.
It's a little late for an "us," Cipher.
I know. I didn't mean it to go this way, Cipher.
But it's over. There really isn't another choice.
We had some good times together.
It's been wonderful.
We did. I--thank you for understanding.
So we just forget each other and walk away? It doesn't work like that.
I don't accept that.
What do you suggest? Partners in the field are one thing, but a Cipher and Keeper--it can't be allowed.
I'm not asking for the world. I'm asking you to keep an open mind.
Give it a chance.
I'm not--you need to leave for Nar Shaddaa. There's a meet set up with Ardun Kothe's men.
I'll... think about what you've said. But focus while you're out there; I want you back alive.
This job can be a nightmare. You've always been my bright spot. I know I've been yours.
We need each other.
Then I suppose we'll both be operating in the dark.
You're impossible. Have it your way, Keeper.
I don't know why I bother.
Thank you, Cipher.
You always think you know precisely what to do.
You've got a lot of nerve.
I was bred for my job. Now I'm asking you to do yours.
In other words, if I do this, I'm on my own.
So you're cutting me off.
Yes. But you'll be doing it for the Empire.
We've set up a meet with one of Ardun Kothe's men. You leave for Nar Shaddaa within the hour.
You need to focus for this one. You'll know when the time comes to strike. Dismissed.
Bury whatever loyalties you have. You'll know when the time comes to strike.
Bury your loyalties for this one, Cipher. You'll know when the time comes to strike. Dismissed.
Now isn't a good time, I'm afraid.
